intro: Dichanthelium, commonly known as false brome, is a genus of grasses belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, blade-like leaves. The flowers are typically arranged in spikelets, which are often clustered in panicles. Many species are found in temperate regions and are adapted to a variety of soil types. Dichanthelium plants are often used in ecological restoration due to their ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
